verses.kjv: In the third year of the reign of Jehoiakim king of Judah came Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon unto Jerusalem, and besieged it.
verses.ct: During the 3rd year that Jehoiakim ruled as king of Judah, King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon marched against Jerusalem and surrounded it.

verses.kjv: And the Lord gave Jehoiakim king of Judah into his hand, with part of the vessels of the house of God: which he carried into the land of Shinar to the house of his god; and he brought the vessels into the treasure house of his god.
verses.ct: The Lord handed Judah's King Jehoiakim over to him, along with some of the items from God's temple. Nebuchadnezzar transported these to the land of Shinar, placing them in the treasury of his god's temple.

verses.kjv: And the king spake unto Ashpenaz the master of his eunuchs, that he should bring certain of the children of Israel, and of the king’s seed, and of the princes;
verses.ct: The king ordered Ashpenaz, the chief of his court officials, to select some young men from the Israelites, including those from the royal family and the nobility.

verses.kjv: Children in whom was no blemish, but well favoured, and skilful in all wisdom, and cunning in knowledge, and understanding science, and such as had ability in them to stand in the king’s palace, and whom they might teach the learning and the tongue of the Chaldeans.
verses.ct: They had to be young men without any physical defect, good-looking, gifted in every area of wisdom, well-educated, quick to learn, and capable of serving in the king's palace. They would be trained in the language and literature of the Babylonians.

verses.kjv: And the king appointed them a daily provision of the king’s meat, and of the wine which he drank: so nourishing them three years, that at the end thereof they might stand before the king.
verses.ct: The king assigned them a daily portion of food and wine from his own table. Their training would last 3 years, after which they would enter the king's service.

verses.kjv: Now among these were of the children of Judah, Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah:
verses.ct: Among those chosen were 4 young men from the tribe of Judah: Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah.

verses.kjv: Unto whom the prince of the eunuchs gave names: for he gave unto Daniel the name of Belteshazzar; and to Hananiah, of Shadrach; and to Mishael, of Meshach; and to Azariah, of Abednego.
verses.ct: The chief official gave them new names: Daniel was called Belteshazzar, Hananiah was called Shadrach, Mishael was called Meshach, and Azariah was called Abednego.

verses.kjv: But Daniel purposed in his heart that he would not defile himself with the portion of the king’s meat, nor with the wine which he drank: therefore he requested of the prince of the eunuchs that he might not defile himself.
verses.ct: But Daniel made up his mind that he would not make himself unclean by eating the king's food or drinking his wine. So he asked the chief official for permission to avoid making himself unclean.

verses.kjv: Now God had brought Daniel into favour and tender love with the prince of the eunuchs.
verses.ct: Now God had caused the chief official to look on Daniel with kindness and compassion.

verses.kjv: And the prince of the eunuchs said unto Daniel, I fear my lord the king, who hath appointed your meat and your drink: for why should he see your faces worse liking than the children which are of your sort? then shall ye make me endanger my head to the king.
verses.ct: The chief official told Daniel, 'I'm afraid of my lord the king, who personally decided what you should eat and drink. What if he sees that you look worse than the other young men your age? You would be putting my life at risk with the king.'

verses.kjv: Then said Daniel to Melzar, whom the prince of the eunuchs had set over Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah,
verses.ct: Daniel then spoke to the guard whom the chief official had put in charge of Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah.

verses.kjv: Prove thy servants, I beseech thee, ten days; and let them give us pulse to eat, and water to drink.
verses.ct: He said, 'Please test us for 10 days. Give us only vegetables to eat and water to drink.

verses.kjv: Then let our countenances be looked upon before thee, and the countenance of the children that eat of the portion of the king’s meat: and as thou seest, deal with thy servants.
verses.ct: Then compare how we look with the young men who eat the king's food, and decide what to do with us based on what you see.'

verses.kjv: So he consented to them in this matter, and proved them ten days.
verses.ct: The guard agreed to this and tested them for 10 days.

verses.kjv: And at the end of ten days their countenances appeared fairer and fatter in flesh than all the children which did eat the portion of the king’s meat.
verses.ct: When the 10 days were over, Daniel and his friends looked healthier and better nourished than all the young men who had been eating the king's food.

verses.kjv: Thus Melzar took away the portion of their meat, and the wine that they should drink; and gave them pulse.
verses.ct: So the guard permanently removed the rich food and wine from their diet and continued giving them only vegetables.

verses.kjv: As for these four children, God gave them knowledge and skill in all learning and wisdom: and Daniel had understanding in all visions and dreams.
verses.ct: God gave these 4 young men exceptional knowledge and understanding in every area of literature and learning. Daniel also received the ability to interpret all kinds of visions and dreams.

verses.kjv: Now at the end of the days that the king had said he should bring them in, then the prince of the eunuchs brought them in before Nebuchadnezzar.
verses.ct: When the training period that the king had set came to an end, the chief official presented all the young men to Nebuchadnezzar.

verses.kjv: And the king communed with them; and among them all was found none like Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah: therefore stood they before the king.
verses.ct: The king spoke with each of them, and out of the entire group, no one compared to Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah. So they were appointed to serve directly before the king.

verses.kjv: And in all matters of wisdom and understanding, that the king enquired of them, he found them ten times better than all the magicians and astrologers that were in all his realm.
verses.ct: Whenever the king consulted them on any matter requiring wisdom and insight, he found them 10 times more capable than every magician and enchanter in his entire kingdom.

verses.kjv: And Daniel continued even unto the first year of king Cyrus.
verses.ct: Daniel remained in this position all the way until the 1st year of King Cyrus.
